ld.headline: Minutes.AI for Android Released
ld.description: "Minutes.AI", which automatically generates meeting minutes from recordings using AI, is now available as an Android app. Install it from Google Play to capture high-quality minutes on the go.

hero.tagline: "Minutes.AI", the app that automatically creates meeting minutes just by recording the meeting, is finally available as an Android app on Google Play. Get high-quality minutes anytime, anywhere, with just your smartphone.

release.p1: In addition to our existing iOS and browser versions, Minutes.AI is now available as an Android app. Simply record your meeting, and our AI will automatically organize the key points and transform them into an easy-to-read meeting summary.
release.p2: The initial version supports the flexible "Flexible" format, with other meeting formats scheduled for sequential release. If you're looking for an AI minutes app for Android, give Minutes.AI a try.

image.alt: Screenshot of the Minutes.AI Android app
image.caption: Record meetings from your Android smartphone, and the AI will generate the minutes directly.

steps.h2: How to Get Started with the Android Version
items: Search for "Minutes.AI" on Google Play, or install from the link on this page
Launch the app and start recording your meeting
When the meeting ends, stop the recording and wait for the AI to generate the minutes
Review the generated minutes, then share or save as needed
steps.note: Available recording time and formats depend on your current plan and remaining time.

features.h2: What You Can Do with the Android Version
items: Record meetings using only your smartphone and have AI automatically create the minutes
Clearly summarize even long meetings with the "Flexible" format
Cloud sync & multi-device support for use on the go
A global AI minutes app supporting over 100 languages
Pricing plans based on time packs or subscriptions to fit your usage style
Some features and formats will be added sequentially in future updates.
Recording quality and minute accuracy are affected by the device's microphone performance and the meeting environment (e.g., noise, number of speakers).
The UI and available features may differ slightly between the Android, iOS, and browser versions.
notes.foot: Try the Android version of Minutes.AI first. If you like it, use it in combination with the iOS app and browser version.
